title: Prime Minister of Singapore
summary: The prime minister of Singapore is the head of government of the Republic of Singapore. The president appoints the prime minister, a Member of Parliament (MP) who, in their opinion, is most likely to command the confidence of the majority of MPs. In practice, the prime minister has been the leader of the political party with the largest amount of elected MPs in the Parliament of Singapore. The incumbent prime minister is Lee Hsien Loong, who is the secretary-general of the People's Action Party.
